metadata.title: CVE-2023-52880 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: tty:n_gsm: require CAP_NET_ADMIN to attach N_GSM0710 ldisc Any unprivilegeduser can attach N_GSM0710 ldisc, but it requires CAP_NET_ADMIN to create aGSM network anyway. Require initial namespace CAP_NET_ADMIN to do that.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52880` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic-64k - 6.6.0-14.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-aws - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-azure - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-gcp - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-ibm - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency - 6.6.0-14.14.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency-64k - 6.6.0-14.14.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-oracle - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.7.0-1001-raspi - 6.7.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required

linux-image-6.7.0-2001-raspi-realtime - 6.7.0-2001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-realtime - 6.8.0-1008.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
